StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os primatas

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Dec
StringTable.String: Uma de nossas colônias descobriu uma próspera raça de primatas inteligentes em um continente recém-descoberto em {PLANETNAME}. Embora sua inteligência não esteja à altura dos padrões galácticos, eles são capazes de simples comunicação e uso de ferramentas.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Não devemos interferir na evolução deles, abandonar o continente recém-descoberto e deixá-los em paz.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +10 Benevolente

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Educá-los e elevar sua cultura para que eles possam se tornar membros produtivos de nossa civilização.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +10 Pragmatico

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Soa como uma força de trabalho ingênua amadurecida para a colheita, coloque-os para trabalhar.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +10 Malevolo

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os Primatas (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Apesar de nossos melhores esforços, nossos colonos continuam a impactar a cultura dos primatas recém-descobertos no {PLANETNAME}. Isto resultou em uma ampla gama de efeitos negativos, desde acidentes fatais até sinais de que os primatas começaram a nos adorar como deuses.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Peça a nossos colonos que deixem este planeta para trás. Deixaremos os nativos ao seu próprio destino.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Cheque benevolente

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Temos que continuar fazendo o melhor que podemos para protegê-los. Multas do Instituto a qualquer colonizador que interfira com os nativos.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Nós demos liberdade aos primatas. Eles escolheram se tornar mais como nós. Vamos nos inclinar para isso.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os Primatas - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Quase todos os nossos colonos votaram para evacuar {PLANETNAME}, deixando isso para os primatas gentis. Isto certamente será um sucesso para nossa economia, mas este momento será lembrado para sempre em nossa história como uma época em que fizemos algo não fácil, mas correto.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+40 Benevolente, {PLANETNAME} A população foi reduzida em 90%, Nave Colônia Grátis.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1b_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os Primatas - O fracasso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Os colonos de {PLANETNAME} rejeitaram nosso apelo para abandonar sua colônia. Em sua ira, eles invadiram o novo continente e praticamente exterminaram os primatas inteligentes de lá. Este certamente será lembrado como um dos dias mais sombrios da história de nossa civilização.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Acrescenta 1 Ladrilho em {PLANETNAME}, +20 Malevolo[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os Primatas - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
A situação no {PLANETNAME} com os primatas inteligentes se estabilizou, graças à nossa rigorosa aplicação da não interferência. Nossos colonos se tornaram muito orgulhosos da florescente cultura nativa, resultando em um impulso significativo no moral da colônia.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15 Pragmatico, +10% moral em {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os Primatas - Sucesso

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Em seu próprio tempo, os primitivos locais de {PLANETNAME} começaram a apreciar nossos esforços educacionais. Os mais promissores deles começaram a se integrar plenamente em nossa sociedade e provaram ser muito úteis em nossas pesquisas sobre os recursos naturais do planeta.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20% Pesquisa em {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crise: Os Primatas (parte 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: Educating the newly discovered primates has proven to be more complicated than we first hoped. We've had some success, but there have now been multiple incidents where lives on both sides were lost. Worse still, many of the colonists we tasked with educating the locals have decided to begin living like the primates themselves, in an attempt to go "back to nature." Lovely for them but this is hardly helping the colony at large.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Education can't come at the cost of lives. Establish guidelines to protect the colonists and the primates.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Redouble our efforts. The sooner we integrate the primates into our culture, the sooner we'll live in peace.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: We can't risk the future of our colony. Forbid all non government interaction with the primates.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our new guidelines on interaction with the primitive natives of {PLANETNAME} have greatly reduced the tension. Already we have found some primates able to show us many unknown resources on the planet we did not know of.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10 Pragmatic, +5 Hyper Silicates, +5 Harmony Crystals[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
After a rocky start, the native education program on {PLANETNAME} has started to pay off. The natives have started to integrate into the greater population and proven to be very helpful in teaching us about our new colony. In addition, the introduction of their unique culture and art to has led to a cultural boom across our entire civilization.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Pragmatic, +25% Colony Influence on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Educating the natives on {PLANETNAME} has proven to be nearly impossible. They greatly resent our interference and have begun to rebel against our very presence on the planet. Ironically the one element of our culture they have quickly adapted to is the use of weapons.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-25% Morale and -10% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Freed from civilian meddling, our program to educate the primates on {PLANETNAME} has finally begun to pay dividends. Careful exposure to our culture and technology has allowed the natives to begin taking on many useful tasks like farming and entertainment. Our researchers believe they will be 100% integrated into our civilization within a generation or two.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+50% Food income and -10% Morale on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our efforts to put the newly discovered primates to work has not gone as smoothly as we had hoped. The fatality rate in particular is astronomical, and those who have avoided labor are starting to foment revolutionary ideas.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: We needed to put them to work, not kill them. The natives should be treated like any other colonist.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Benevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Do not kill off our cheap labor. Establish minimum native rights, so they get back to work.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Crack down on employers that waste native lives. They are a valuable resource.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our efforts to give the natives on {PLANETNAME} the same rights as our citizens have proven mostly successful. Though their natural limitations limit their potential, their quality of life has greatly improved, and thoughts of rebellion seem to have subsided.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10 Benevolent, +15% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our colonists on {PLANETNAME} have not reacted well to our efforts to give native workers the same rights as them. If anything, cruelty towards the primitive population has increased. There is a good chance they will not survive another generation of this treatment, though on the bright side that means there will not be many left to rebel.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10 Malevolent[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Thanks to the token gestures we've made on their behalf, the natives of {PLANETNAME} have gone back to work. Accident rates have normalized, and a modest but real improvement in their standard of living has resulted. Any talk of revolution has been quelled, at least for now.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
By cracking down on the colonists who were wasting the lives of the natives of {PLANETNAME}, we've lowered the accident rate and greatly improved our manufacturing productivity. The natives themselves don't seem that appreciative our efforts, but they're simple that way.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Malevolent, +20% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Primates - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Primates_Choice_3f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Cracking down on the colonists that were wasting the lives of the natives on {PLANETNAME} has not proven very effective. The natives have taken matters into their own hands and begun to vocally - and physically - demand rights. A very short rebellion has resulted, and though it did not end well for the natives, it hasn't done much for our manufacturing sector either.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5 Malevolent, -15% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Dec
StringTable.String: A new plant has been found on {PLANETNAME} with strong narcotic effects. In the short term it makes people extremely content and relaxed and somewhat better musicians. But the long term health effects are thought to be dangerous, and it's already begun to reduce the planet's production.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: We can't let this keep going. Ban the drug.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Let's not rush into anything. Study the drug to find out all its effects.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: There's obvious value here. We should commercialize this new drug.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our attempts to ban the new drug on {PLANETNAME} have only drawn wider attention to its potency. Smugglers have begun exporting it offworld. We risk losing control of the situation.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Crack down on the exporters. Also, find and destroy the plants themselves.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: We should focus on treatment and harm reduction, to counteract the worst effects.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Lock down the planet, then hunt down any execute anyone caught dealing the drug.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our efforts to rid {PLANETNAME} of the dangerously new addictive drug have been successful. No longer will our people fear being trapped in an endless haze of joy and good will towards others. They'll understand eventually.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Benevolent, -5% Morale for 10 turns on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We've found a treatment for the drug affecting {PLANETNAME}, one that not only counteracts the negative aspects of the drug, but also leaves those recovering from their addiction more productive than ever. They're a bit cranky, mind you.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-5% Morale for 25 turns, and 25% Production for 100 turns on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our public health professionals have managed to mitigate the worst effects of the drug, but we've sadly been unsuccessful in our attempts to restrict its usage. It's already made its way off-planet, and is now being sold in black markets across our civilization. Perhaps not what the leaders of {PLANETNAME} wanted to be known for, but morale is up at least.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Global +5% Morale for 25 turns, and -5% Production for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We've successfully stopped the distribution of the new drug on {PLANETNAME}, saving the rest of our civilization from its dangerous effects. But the harshness of our enforcement measures has not helped morale on the planet itself. A lesson they'll have to remember.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Malevolent, -5% Morale for 25 turns[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: We've made a breakthrough in our research of the new drug on {PLANETNAME}. The drug is an unusually versatile substance, and is capable of affecting brain chemistry in a variety of ways. How should we direct our further research efforts?

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Study it for medical use.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Study the productive aspects of the drug.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Study it for military use.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our scientists have isolated the morale boosting properties of the new drug. Obvious morale-boosting applications if left in civilian hands, but this should also prove beneficial in our medical and physiological fields.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Morale, +25% research on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our attempt to study the new drug has backfired. Although our researchers found a way to amplify the positive effects of the drug, they were unable to find any way to offset the negative effects. If anything, it is now more addictive than ever, and is now being used widely across the planet. The good news is everyone is too happy and sedate to export it to other worlds.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Morale and -33% Production for 50 turns on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Unfortunately, our scientists have not been able to isolate the morale boosting aspect of the drug. We have however discovered a way to reverse its effect. People who take the drug now become very unhappy, though interestingly, also very productive. This has obviously resulted in less people wanting to take it, but those still addicted have become economic dynamos.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-5% Morale and +33% Production for 100 turns on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Sadly, our attempts to commercialize this new miracle drug have not worked out too well. Most of the team we committed to the effort have become addicted to it themselves, and their feeble efforts have resulted in the drug escaping into the black market, where it's now being distributed across almost all our worlds.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Global +5% Morale and -5% Production for 50 turns on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers have found a way to concentrate the drug, safely amplifying its sedative effects. They believe that if it can be introduced to the population of a planet shortly before an invasion, it will effectively debilitate the locals so much that they will welcome our invasion forces with open arms.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Global Effect: +10% Soldiering, +10% Resistance[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: We have managed to purify the new drug on {PLANETNAME}, rendering it safer while increasing its more attractive aspects. However there is some concern that it has become too addictive for widespread use. Some of our test subjects claim they can no longer feel any joy without the drug.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Stop any further research, and wipe out the plant before its use becomes too widespread.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Restrict the plant from civilian use, retaining it for medical or research purposes only.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Sounds like a gold mine. Let's put it in to full production.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have managed to wipe out the plants that are the source of the new drug discovered on {PLANETNAME}. Not only that, our researchers were able to create a synthetic version of the drug that is not addictive at all, though nowhere near as powerful. We should be able to distribute it for general use without any lasting downsides.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5 Benevolent, +15% Morale on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our efforts to restrict usage of the new drug to the medical field on {PLANETNAME} seems to have been successful. Public usage has been reduced to almost nothing, and the drug's obvious use as a painkiller and therapeutic aid have proven to be very successful.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Research and +25% colony income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
This new drug has proven to be a commercial hit, the galaxy having an apparently bottomless appetite for it. The downsides, if there are any, will surely be offset by the sheer amounts of money this new enterprise is bringing in.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-1% Global Growth and +50% Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: New Drug - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Drugs_Choice_3f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Unfortunately our formula for the newly refined drug was leaked, allowing criminals to refine the plant without us. Now not only do we have all the downsides of a rampantly addictive drug loose on our worlds, we're not even making any money off of it.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5% Global Morale, -2% Global Production, -1% Global Growth for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Fissure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Dec
StringTable.String: A giant fissure has opened up on a remote island on {PLANETNAME}, and enormous monsters have begun to emerge from it. The fissure seems to be a gateway to another universe, but all attempts to observe what's on the other side have thus far failed. The monsters seem to be under control when constrained to the island, but this is obviously a very dangerous situation. If they escaped the island there'd be little stopping them from causing havoc across the planet.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Let's attempt to study the monsters in place on the island.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +10 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Try to capture and domesticate the monsters.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +10 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Create giant robots to fight the monsters, and keep them from escaping the island.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +10 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: We've begun our efforts to study the monster fissure and the resulting stream of monsters on {PLANETNAME}. Research is going well, and it looks like we might learn a great deal from these creatures. Unfortunately word of this "Monster Island" has leaked out, and unauthorized tourists are beginning to become an issue.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Turn the island into a formal tourist attraction, with rigid safety precautions.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Ban all tourism. Make sure only researchers have access to the monsters.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Monster Island has become a huge success. Any incidents, of which there have been few, have widely been considered to be the tourists' fault.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% colony income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
By limiting access to Monster Island to our own scientific teams, they've had unparalleled access to the monsters and rift itself, leading to several breakthroughs.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+30% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Sadly our researchers on Monster Island have become careless, allowing several monsters to escape to the mainland. Local authorities responded with a nuclear strike on the island, which, although it collapsed the fissure, did also destroy one of our most valuable research facilities. And, obviously, the researchers inside.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-10% Population on {PLANETNAME} and -50% Research for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have managed to learn to control some of the monsters on {PLANETNAME}, though others have resisted - often violently - all our efforts. In addition, the monsters continue to come through the rift, and our researchers are concerned they will not have space for them on the island much longer.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Try and use these monsters as beasts of burden.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Turn the monsters into weapons.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The monsters have proven relatively useful when used in large scale demolition and some of the more dangerous aspects of terraforming. We've even begun to export them to other worlds to assist in their terraforming needs.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+30% colony income and +1 Tile on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We've successfully managed to turn the monsters into mobile platforms of destruction. With them we will have a great - and cinematic - advantage in any future invasions.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Global Effect: +10% Soldiering and +10% Resistance for 100 turns[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Unfortunately our efforts to tame the monsters have failed, and if anything, taught them to be far more dangerous. Many monsters took the lessons taught to them to break free of the island, and reigned terror on a large portion of the colony before they could be stopped.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-33% Population on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Not only have our use of giant robots to contain the monsters on {PLANETNAME} been successful, footage of their titanic struggles have been smuggled off world and become a viral sensation. We now have to deal with a stream of tourists - often very well-heeled tourists - coming to the island insisting on watching the fights.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: We can't risk this. Seal the rift so we don't endanger any innocent lives.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Let's make monster fighting an official sport then. Turn the island into a virtual stadium for the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Lock down the island, and ban all rebroadcast of our containment efforts.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers were able to seal the fissure, though not without cost, a large energy spike killing the crew that was doing the work. It's not all bad news though, their efforts made us realize this fissure was a type of controlled wormhole. Our researchers think they can use this knowledge to boost our hyperdrive performance.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1 Global Ship Speed.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3b_Dec
StringTable.String:
We failed, in a sense. While trying to seal the rift on {PLANETNAME}, an explosion sucked the entirety of Monster Island into another universe. No more monsters, and no more rift, though the explosion also decimated a sizable chunk of the colony itself.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-33% Population on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our Monster League battles, as we're now calling them, have become a huge success. The rift seems to be responding to the challenge, the monsters that emerge from it getting bigger and bigger. Hey that's just more credits, right?
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+33% colony Income.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Monster Fissure - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Fissure_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We seem to have stopped the illegal broadcast of the monster fights, and for the most part the existing videos are now being written off as fake. In addition we have discovered many uses for the corpse of the monsters, both for research and commercial purposes.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+33% colony Income and +15% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Dec
StringTable.String: Rumor has begun to circulate of a new group of disciplined and deadly pirates that have begun operating around the borders of our civilization. They have not done much harm to us yet, but their growing reputation has the leaders of many of our outlying colonies concerned.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Find out where they are coming from, so we can stop them at the source.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: If they are effective killers, perhaps we can use them. Try and recruit these pirates.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: We will never tolerate piracy in any form. Hunt them down and kill them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: While investigating the mysterious new pirates, we have come to realize they are operating from a hidden planetary base somewhere within our own borders. The planet seems to be of high quality given the resources that the pirates are able to muster.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Hunt down the pirates, but leave their world alone if they promise to stay on it.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Find the pirates and force them to show us where this planet of theirs is.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Find the pirate world and destroy it, before they can become too powerful.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our commanders report a partial success. We were able to capture the main pirate force, and even salvaged a few of their ships. But we were not able to find out the location of their base.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]1 Frigate, 2 Gunboats and 1 Battle Axe.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to track down most of the pirates and trace them back to their secret base. We were able to capture it with little effort. though some of the pirates did manage to flee. They're pretty angry.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]New planet discovered. Small group of pirates spawn in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to track down the pirate base, but unfortunately when we arrived we found they had already fled the planet. The traps they've left behind have left it almost unlivable.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Low level planet Discovered, Multiple pirates spawn in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to track down the pirate secret base, and then drop a few asteroids on it. They won't be using that again. In addition we were able to capture several ships that were still in orbit when we arrived.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award 2 Frigates[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: While tracking down the mysterious new pirates we've discovered that most of them are former members of our military. Spies report that many of them are potentially willing to come back into the fold, but others are by now hardened criminals, guilty of far more serious crimes than mutiny.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Offer them blanket immunity, as long as no further crimes are committed.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: If they will give up the worst offenders the honest ones will be welcomed back with open arms.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Deserters all of them. Who needs them. Kill them all.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
The pirates have reluctantly surrendered the most wanted members, ending the crisis almost without bloodshed. Only one ship fled, but one more pirate in the galaxy is nothing to be too concerned about.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Battleship and 2 Frigates, 1 pirate spawn in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_2d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Although some of the pirates were willing to turn over the worst offenders, those worst offenders were worse offenders for a reason. Vicious, and far better armed, they quickly destroyed the traitors. The pirates which remain are now extremely unhappy with us.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Multiple Pirates spawn in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: We've been relatively successful in confronting the mysterious new pirates, and have captured a great number of them. Many appear to be former members of our own military, using our equipment and training to forge a new life for themselves outside of what they feel is our too restrictive society.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Try and repatriate them back into the military.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Benevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Fine. Let them know that we will look the other way as long as they do it outside of our borders.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Not just pirates, but deserters and criminals then. Kill them all.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
While most of the pirates have been willing to come back to the military, bringing a small force of ships with them, others have fled deeper into the borderlands. We fear they'll be a problem in the future.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Battleship and 2 Frigates, a small force of pirates spawn in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3b_Dec
StringTable.String:
None of the pirates seem that interested in repatriation, and by reaching out to them they have become much more leery of us. We fear the next time we see them they'll be there to attack.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Multiple Pirates spawn in your territory.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
The pirates seem to have taken the hint, and moved outside of our borders. Indeed they seem to be making a lot of trouble for our enemies now. We'll call that a win.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Pragmatic[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mercenary Pirates - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pirates_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to capture the main pirate force. Well, destroy it. That's good too. We did salvage a few of their ships though.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Award Frigate, 2 Gunboats and a Battle Axe.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is reporting an unexpected rise in the number of mutations occurring within the colony. They have determined that something is contaminating the planet's biome, but have not been able to determine the source. All they know is that it doesn't seem to be a natural occurrence. Strangely, most of these mutations have had net positive effects on the colonists, with a very low fatality rate. This has only reinforced the local belief that they are being caused purposefully.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Send a team to find out what is causing these mutations and stop them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Send a team to study the mutations and find out if we need to stop them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Send a team to find who is causing these mutations, and offer them a job.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our investigators on {PLANETNAME} have found the source of the recent mutations. It appears that a rogue team of our own researchers have found a way to reprogram Precursor nanites to modify the genetics of biological creatures. A commendable accomplishment, offset somewhat by them then releasing these nanites into the public. Luckily the nanites are not self-replicating, and their limited supply has restricted the amount of damage they've been able to do.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Arrest the researchers and put them to work undoing what they have done.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Arrest the researchers and seize their stockpile of Precursor nanites.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Arrest the researchers and turn their research over to the military.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The researchers have been very helpful in correcting the negative effects of their clandestine experiment. They have even turned over their remaining supply of Precursor nanites. More importantly life on {PLANETNAME} has returned to normal.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Benevolent, +5% Research on {PLANETNAME}, +1 Precursor Nanites.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to stop the researchers, and turn them over to the local authorities. Not only that, we were also able to find their stash of Precursor nanites.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10 Pragmatic, +10 Precursor Nanites[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Before we could arrest the researchers, they caught wind of our efforts, and released the remaining Precursor nanites into the atmosphere. While we were able to stop their experiment, there's no saying what the long term results of their actions will mean for {PLANETNAME}.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Research, -5% Production, -10% Morale for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to arrest and stop the rogue researchers on {PLANETNAME}. Their research has been very enlightening to our military people, who believe they will be able to substantially, and more or less safely, use it to enhance the fighting ability of our soldiers.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Global Effect: +10% Soldiering and +10% Resistance for 100 turns[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our investigators on {PLANETNAME} have found that the strange wave of mutations in the colony has been caused by Precursor nanites that have somehow been programmed to restructure the genetics of anyone they infect.
Though not all of the modifications are helpful to the victims, the majority are, and our researchers from the colony itself insist that the mutations are a net gain to the population of the colony.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: No one should have their genetics tampered with unknowingly. Find who is doing this and stop them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Find who is doing this, so that we can make the process safer.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Make sure anyone who has a negative reaction to the mutations is "taken care of."

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have found a group of rogue researchers responsible for the mutations on {PLANETNAME}. After confessing to their experiments, we were able to 'convince' them to use their research to reverse the damage they had done.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Pragmatic, +10% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have found a group of rogue researchers responsible for the mutations on {PLANETNAME}. We have convinced them that if they work with us, and help make the process safer, they can avoid criminal charges. A morally dubious, but highly profitable arrangement.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Research, and +15% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We have quietly made sure that any and all adverse mutations on {PLANETNAME} are to be 'removed' from the population. Whoever is doing the experiments seems to be continuing their work, and the more helpful mutations seem to be having a positive effect throughout the colony. Everything from manufacturing, to research, to entertainment has seen measurable boosts.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Research, +15% Morale and +10% Production on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_2f_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our attempt to remove the more problematic mutants from the general population of {PLANETNAME} has backfired. Not only have the mutations continued to occur, people are now concerned about the uptick in "disappearances".
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-10% Morale, -5% Research, and -5% Production for 50 turns on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: We have found the rogue group of researchers on {PLANETNAME} that are responsible for the recent outbreak of mutations on the colony. Somehow they have learned to reprogram Precursor nanites to restructure the genetics of biological creatures. Despite their clandestine methods they have been greatly successful, and would have been more so if they had not run out of Precursor nanites.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Turn the researchers over to the local authorities, and seize all their research.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Hire these researchers and establish an official lab dedicated to their work.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Provide the nanites, if they focus on mutations that will improve our soldiers.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to stop the researchers and turned them over to the local authorities. Fortunately we also seized most of their research, including their remaining supply of Precursor nanites.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+5 Precursor Nanites and +25% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
The rogue researchers on {PLANETNAME} were happy to come out of the shadows when we offered them immunity for their crimes and their own government research lab. The general population was not quite as happy when word of this arrangement leaked. Looks like we're going to be in for a bit of a morale hit.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-10% Morale, +25% Research, and +25% Colony Income on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3d_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our negotiations with the rogue researchers on {PLANETNAME} were going well until the local press found out what they had been doing. A mob stormed the research facility and murdered the scientists responsible, one and all. Sadly all their research was lost, as well as any Precursors nanites that they still had. Needless to say, the general population is also not terribly happy to know we were willing to work with these criminals.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-33% Morale for 100 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Mutations - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mutations_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
Working quietly with the rogue researchers on {PLANETNAME}, our own scientists have been able to achieve some great results. Keeping the nature of this research quiet has proven to be more expensive then we had hoped however, though the end results should prove to be worth it.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Research, +15% Production and -10% colony income on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Dec
StringTable.String: One of our colonies has been hit hard by a previously unknown disease that has crossed over from the native biome and has begun killing our colonists at an alarming 33% fatality rate. It is currently confined to a single continent, but there is concern that it will quickly become a global pandemic if left unchecked. One curious side effect of the disease is that the survivors appear to be left without the ability to experience pain of any kind. They are calling the disease "Painkiller".

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: We must stop this disease before it spreads across the colony.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Quarantine the colony, so that it doesn't spread off world.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Immune to pain you say? Study these survivors, so that they might prove useful.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +25 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Limiting the spread of the "Painkiller" disease has proven to be very difficult. Despite our best efforts, it has managed to spread to the entire colony, and killed much of our original response team. With our limited manpower, it will infect the entire population in a matter of weeks.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Ask for volunteers to help fight the disease, and quarantine anyone trying to leave the colony.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Science check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Lock down the planet, but begin delivering emergency supplies to help those trapped there.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Quarantine the planet entirely, and destroy any ship that tries to escape.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our volunteer relief forces on {PLANETNAME} have had great success fighting the Painkiller disease, and managed to keep it from migrating off-planet. In addition, by studying the disease, they have been able to not only find a cure, but also a method for isolating its analgesic properties, creating a new medication that should soothe the sick and wounded throughout the galaxy.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10 Pragmatic, +5% global morale, +5% global research.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Most of our volunteer force on {PLANETNAME} has succumbed to the disease. Worse, as news of the pandemic spread, widespread rioting occurred, resulting in the deaths of anyone even accused of having symptoms. The only bright side to this tragedy is that the disease does finally seem to have been wiped out.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Planet population halved, -50% Morale for 25 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our supply drops on {PLANETNAME} have been very successful. The Painkiller disease has been brought completely under control, and our researchers there think they will have a cure for it soon.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Benevolent, +10% Research on {PLANETNAME}[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
The Painkiller disease has run its course on {PLANETNAME}. Sadly, the population of the planet was devastated, but we have successfully kept the sickness from leaving the planet. We will never really know if we could have helped more. But we do know that this could have been much, much worse.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+33 Pragmatic and -33% Population.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our researchers on {PLANETNAME} have reported back. The "Painkiller" disease has spread throughout the colony, though they appear to have substantially reduced its mortality rate. However they are concerned that even with these countermeasures, there is still a great risk of the disease escaping the planet.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Lock down the planet, but begin delivering emergency supplies to help those trapped there.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Quarantine the planet entirely, and destroy any ship that tries to escape.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: They'll be desperate. Make sure they know that we are recruiting for our military.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_2_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: The devastation of our colony from the "Painkiller" disease has been staggering, the population reduced by at least a third. The survivors though seem to be in perfect health - besides no longer being able to experience physical pain. But they are not at all happy with our decision to lock down their world and treat them as test subjects.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Have the military deliver humanitarian supplies. Let them know we support them. Maybe they'll join us.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: There's a reason for it. Send in researchers to study the pain killing effect of the virus.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Let them know that the only way they will ever get off the planet is as soldiers.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our supply runs to the surface of {PLANETNAME} have been welcomed by the survivors of the Painkiller disease. Most of them simply want a way off their devastated planet. Fortunately for us, their peculiar conditions have made them valuable recruits.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Soldiering globally, +25% Resistance and -15% Population on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Despite our generous donations, the survivors on {PLANETNAME} do not generally seem to be interested in joining the military. In fact, it's been the exact opposite. These victims of the pandemic are proving to be the ruthless warriors as we hoped, but they're attacking our own recruiters.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-33% Population and -50% Morale for 50 turns.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our researchers have made some interesting breakthroughs studying the victims of the "Painkiller" disease. They think they will be able to isolate the pain resistant effects of the virus, and use it to great effect both in the military and medical fields. Unfortunately {PLANETNAME}s population has paid a terrible price for this knowledge.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Global Research, +5% Soldiering globally, -33% Population on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Painkiller - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Pandemic_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
The situation on {PLANETNAME} has become so desperate that people have begun purposely infecting themselves, in hope of surviving the illness and becoming immune enough to be allowed to leave the planet. This has been a boon to our recruiters, as they now have no lack of newly painless soldiers volunteering to get off-world.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Soldiering globally, -33% Population on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Dec
StringTable.String: A series of murders on {PLANETNAME} have recently come to our attention. The local authorities haven't been able to find any suspects, or even a motive for the crimes, though they note that it might have something to do with the fact that each victim has had their brain completely removed.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Investigate the local research facilities. They might know who would need so many brains.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Investigate the local authorities themselves. They must be covering something up.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Why the brain? Send researchers to see if they can find any clues that explain that.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +25 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Our investigators have found the missing brains in a local research facility, but have been unable to locate the murderer. Their only lead is an anonymous tip suggesting it's not a coincidence that this facility is one of the best in the galaxy, responsible for many recent breakthroughs.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: That doesn't mean anything. Find the killer at any cost.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Make it loudly known that if the murders stop, you might stop your investigation.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Find the murderer, if brains are needed to boost research, we can provide them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The murderer on {PLANETNAME} has been found. Unfortunately, it's turned out to be one of our best researchers, using the brains of his victims to create a new sort of neural computer. The experiment over, we're now likely to see a drop in the planet's research capabilities.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Pragmatic, +10% Morale and -25% Research for 25 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our message has been received, though we don't yet know by who. The murders have abruptly stopped, and life on {PLANETNAME} appears to be getting back to normal. Interestingly, the research center we found the brains in has experienced a sudden increase in output.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+10% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
With some quiet digging we have found the murderer on {PLANETNAME}. It's turned out to be one of our best researchers, who is building a new sort of neural computer with actual, living brains. It didn't take us more than a few quick trips to the bad areas in town to provide everything he needed to complete it.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+20 Malevolent, +20% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_1f_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to find the murderer, but he did not seem interested in sharing his research with us. We did however learn a few things from the prototype neural computer he had been assembling thanks to his dark deeds, and his own brain will make a nice addition to its processing power.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+1% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our investigators on {PLANETNAME} have discovered that someone in the government appears to be covering up for the murders, to preserve the colony's reputation. {PLANETNAME} has been one of the more successful in our colonies, particularly when it comes to the quality of their research. Someone at or near the top is trying to stop word of these murders from becoming common knowledge.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Let the government know that if they do not cooperate immediately, the murders will be the number one story on GNN.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Find out who is leading this cover-up, and arrest them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: This seems like a local issue. Let them deal with it themselves.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2a_Dec
StringTable.String:
The murders on {PLANETNAME} have abruptly stopped. Interestingly, a high profile research center on the colony run by the Governors brother has also experienced a sudden increase in output. These do not seem to be unrelated, but we're not going to push our luck any further.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2b_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2b_Dec
StringTable.String:
Although the murders on {PLANETNAME} have abruptly stopped, both the colony's governor and the head of our most productive research facility have abruptly vanished. This probably wasn't a coincidence.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-10% Morale, -10% Production and -10% Research for 25 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Much to our surprise we have found that the governor of the colony himself has been covering up for the murders. He has been removed from his position, denying he did anything wrong. Interestingly, a high profile research center on the colony, run by his brother, has also experienced a sudden increase in output.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Research on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
The murders on {PLANETNAME} have slowed substantially, but not stopped. The steady drumbeat of deaths is beginning to frighten the civilians. In somewhat positive, possibly unrelated news, a high profile research center on the colony run by the governor's brother has suddenly experienced a large increase in output.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+25% Research and -5% Morale on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: Following a quiet investigation on {PLANETNAME}, we have discovered that the brains of the murdered victims were all from particular intelligent, if not successful citizens, each one known as a free thinker of some kind. Artists, scientists, performers. Our current theory is that someone is removing these brains to find out what they all have in common.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: We have to protect our great minds. Find the murderer at any cost.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Have our researchers also try and figure out what the murderer is looking for.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Find the murderer. If brains boost their research, we can provide them.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3c_Dec
StringTable.String:
Our investigation into commonalities between the victim's brains has to lead us to a local research lab, whose scientists are attempting to create a new type of Neural network. It appears that the leader of this team is, if not the murderer himself, at least paying someone to gather brains for him. We have arrested him and seized his research. It looks promising, even without the supply of brains.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]+15% Global Research for 100 turns[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Murderer on the loose - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Murderer_Choice_3d_Dec
StringTable.String:
When it became known that we had established a team to track down the missing brains on {PLANETNAME}, the murders abruptly stopped. Unfortunately, both the colony's governor and the head of our most productive research facility on the planet also vanished around the same time. We are, for now, prepared to call this a coincidence and close the book on the matter.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]-10% Morale, -10% Production and -10% Research for 25 turns on {PLANETNAME}.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Dec
StringTable.String:
A nearly complete Overload Class ship was stolen from our shipyards.
Strangely, the commander of the deserter ship is reputed to be one of our best. In fact he recently returned from a very successful tour commanding a survey ship, during which his record was exemplary.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Try and figure out why he would have stolen the ship, and convince him to bring it back.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Benevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Track down the deserter and take our ship back by force.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Pragmatic

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Hunt the deserter down, and execute them. Destroy the ship if necessary.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: +15 Malevolent

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: The commander of the ship has refused to accept our hails, but we learned from his superiors that before he left he was talking about having to get back to a wormhole he had surveyed on his last tour. The 'future of the galaxy' depends on him apparently. Before he deserted they were considering putting him under psychological review, but hesitated, not wanting to ruin the reputation of such a well-respected commander.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Allow the commander to reach the wormhole, as long as he doesn't endanger anyone else.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Send his commanding officers to talk the Commander down. They know him.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Pragmatic check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Blockade the wormhole, and prevent the commander from entering it at all cost.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1a_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1a_Dec
StringTable.String:
Shortly after arriving at the wormhole, the stolen Overlord intercepted some sort of giant space creature that was beginning emerge from it and engaged it in combat. The overlord was victorious but damaged badly, plunging into the wormhole itself. Our observers were about to depart when the ship re-emerged, this time with three of our survey ships in tow, ones we had thought lost forever.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Overlord Captured.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1c_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1c_Dec
StringTable.String:
The commander of the stolen overlord agreed to allow his former Admiral to board the ship. But before the Admiral could talk sense into the rogue commander, they arrived at the wormhole, where a giant space monster was beginning to emerge. Our commander was telling the truth! The overlord engaged the beast and emerged victorious but damaged badly, plunging into the wormhole itself. Our observers were about to depart when the ship re-emerged, this time with three of our survey ships in tow, ones we had thought lost forever.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Overlord Captured, 3 Survey ships found.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1d_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1d_Dec
StringTable.String:
The commander of the stolen Overlord agreed to allow his former Admiral to board the ship, and after a long conversation agreed to turn over command to him. Unfortunately while this was happening several space monsters began emerging from the wormhole. They quickly destroyed the Overlord, now being commanded by the confused Admiral, and escaped into our galaxy.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]One large space monster appears.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_1e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We managed to blockade the wormhole and recapture the stolen Overlord. Unfortunately while we were focused on the deserters, a giant space monster began to emerge from the phenomena. During the attack, the deserter commander escaped in a shuttle filled with explosives, which he used to ram the space monster. The explosion that resulted not only killed the creature, it collapsed the wormhole forever.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Overlord Captured[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Dec
StringTable.String: We have located the ship, and managed to make contact with a member of the crew. She claims that the commander has gone crazy, and is taking them to a wormhole that he claims he must take the ship through. The future of our civilization depends on it, he claims.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Send his commanding officers to try and talk to the Commander. But be ready to stop the ship if necessary.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Choice1BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Benevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Allow the ship to reach the wormhole. If nothing happens, capture the ship and crew alive if possible.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Demand he surrender the ship. If he doesn't, destroy it before it reaches the wormhole.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2_Choice3BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Malevolent check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2e_Dec
StringTable.String:
The commander of the stolen Overlord refused to surrender the ship, forcing us to engage it in battle. Unfortunately during the battle, a giant space monster began emerging from the wormhole. At this point, the deserter commander broke off the engagement and launched a shuttle filled with explosives into the creature, causing an explosion that not only killed the beast, but also collapsed the wormhole forever.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Overlord Captured[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2f_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Failure

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_2f_Dec
StringTable.String:
The commander of the stolen Overlord has refused to surrender the ship. We were forced to engage them in battle, destroying the vessel. Unfortunately during the battle, several large space monsters emerged from the wormhole and escaped into our universe, suggesting our insane commander may have been on to something.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Several large space monsters appear.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander (part 2)

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Dec
StringTable.String: We have located the ship, and rescued a member of the crew. She claims that the commander has gone crazy, and is taking them to a wormhole that he claims he must take the ship through. The future of our civilization depends on it, he claims.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Choice1Dec
StringTable.String: Blockade the wormhole, and prevent the ship from entering it at all cost.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Choice2Dec
StringTable.String: Demand that he surrender the ship. If he doesn't, destroy it before it reaches the wormhole.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Choice2BonusDec
StringTable.String: {STATCHANCE}% Military check

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3_Choice3Dec
StringTable.String: Destroy the ship. Desertion can not be tolerated, even from one of our best.

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3e_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: Distinguished Commander - Success

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Deserters_Choice_3e_Dec
StringTable.String:
We were able to intercept and destroy the stolen overlord, however, during the battle, some sort of giant space monster began emerging from the wormhole. Our surviving ships were able to collapse the wormhole, but one of the creatures managed to escape into our universe.
[COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]One large space monster appears.[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Name
StringTable.String: Crisis: The Mad Governor

StringTable.Label: Crisis_Mad_Governor_Dec
StringTable.String:
The Governor of {PLANETNAME} has begun acting very erratically. We have received reports of him issuing strange edicts to the colony, mandating city-wide parties.
